author: Aaron Mesmer
title: Jail staffing questioned after violent attack on Hillsborough detention deputy by inmate | FOX 13 Tampa Bay
text: An inmate in the Hillsborough County jail could be locked up for decades after investigators said he attacked a detention deputy, leaving him with serious injuries.According to court documents, the deputy was questioning inside one of the jail's housing units and, when the deputy tried to place Fulton in handcuffs, "the defendant pulled away and struck him in the face with a closed fist."The criminal report affidavit indicates the attack, which was recorded by the jail's security cameras, lasted about four minutes before another inmate was able to pull Fulton off the deputy.Following Fulton's pretrial detention hearing Thursday, which was continued until Monday, Hillsborough State Attorney Suzy Lopez said she wants Fulton to receive the maximum 30-year sentence."This is one of the most violent videos that I have ever seen. It absolutely turned my stomach when I saw it. It's horrific," Lopez said. "He absolutely cannot be walking amongst us in our community. He deserves to be behind bars. I'm not sure where the jail is going to put him because he's also shown that he can't be safe."Lopez said Fulton is an accused violent criminal out of Broward County who was arrested in Hillsborough for violating his probation. OTHER NEWS: Florida launches ‘Check My Contract’ portal to help storm victims avoid bad contracts The details of the attack in court documents left former corrections officers questioning how the fight lasted several minutes."I was shocked because four minutes is an eternity," said Joe Rojas, who is retired after spending 30 years as a corrections officer and federal union representative. "It seems forever, just for a minute, let alone four minutes. It's ridiculous and that's scary. It's amazing that he survived. Thank God he survived."A sheriff's office spokesperson said the deputy's radio had been knocked away during the fight, so he couldn't immediately call for help. The response by deputies monitoring the security cameras is unclear.Rojas, meanwhile, wonders if this is an indication of staffing issues he said are plaguing corrections facilities nationwide."The staffing from the state to the city to the county, and we're all dealing with the same thing, it is incredibly low and dangerous," he said.During Fulton's hearing, the Hillsborough County Sheriff's Office asked the judge to prevent the media from viewing and recording video of the attack. That decision is expected to come next week. STAY CONNECTED WITH FOX 13 TAMPA:

author: redazione
title: L’Onu denuncia che in Cisgiordania Israele provoca l’aumento delle violenze dei coloni contro i palestinesi
text:
Ajith Sunghay, capo dell’ufficio delle Nazioni Unite per i diritti umani nei territori palestinesi occupati, ha detto ad Al Jazeera che la mancanza di responsabilità – e in alcuni casi l’incitamento da parte dei funzionari israeliani – ha portato a un aumento sia della violenza dei coloni che della violenza commessa da parte di israeliani. forze nella Cisgiordania occupata.
In particolare, ha detto Sunghay, c’è stato un aumento degli attacchi collettivi di coloni contro i palestinesi. Ha parlato poco dopo che l’agenzia delle Nazioni Unite ha pubblicato un rapporto che invita Israele a ridurre la violenza, che ha provocato la morte di 291 palestinesi nella Cisgiordania occupata dal 7 ottobre.
Secondo il rapporto, i coloni israeliani hanno ucciso otto di queste vittime, e un palestinese è stato ucciso dalle truppe israeliane o dai coloni.
“Penso che sia estremamente importante sottolinearlo: dove c’è impunità le violazioni continueranno a verificarsi”, ha affermato.
Ha aggiunto: “Queste dichiarazioni [dei funzionari israeliani] incoraggiano i coloni, danno loro un senso di sicurezza, danno loro un certo tipo di permesso di fare ciò che vogliono”.
Argomenti:
Nazioni Unite

author: Matilda Rudd
title: Best advent calendar on sale for beauty lovers: The Iconic has discounted its most wanted beauty box by 30 per cent
text:
Gone are the days when we’d only buy advent calendars to
countdown the days until Christmas, with a reward of simple chocolates.
Now more than ever brands are building calendars filled with gifts and travel-sized products that you can actually use long after Santa has visited.
And the best part is when they’re immediately discounted during the post-Christmas period, like
The Iconic’s “Beauty’s Most Wanted” calendar, which retailed for $249 in early December.
Catch the best deals and products hand-picked by our team at
Best Picks >>
For a
limited time only it’s 30 per cent off bringing the price down to $174.30.
Expertly curated by beauty insiders, the
Beauty’s Most Wanted collection is the ultimate edit of holy grail products from top beauty brands.
From skincare and makeup to hair, body and fragrance, it’s the perfect way to indulge in 23 hero formulas that are valued at $700.
Inside customers will get six full-sized products, 13 travel size and four deluxe minis from Medik8, Olaplex, MAC and Ultra Violette, among others.
What’s in the beauty calendar?
1. Medik8 Hydr8 B5 30ml (full size)Like a tall glass of water for your skin, Medik8’s cult moisturising serum is infused with multi-weight hyaluronic acid and vitamin B5 to leave your complexion plump, supple and hydrated from its deepest layers right to the top.
2. MAC Matte Lipstick 3g (full size)For a long-wearing matte formula that won’t leave your pout parched, you can’t beat MAC’s signature Matte Lipstick. Creamy, rich and smooth, you’ll want to try them all — but Honeylove or Taupe are great shades to start.
3. Ultra Violette Fave Fluid SPF50+ Ultralight SKINSCREEN 30mlLightweight, silky and stacked with skin-loving ingredients like niacinamide, vitamin C and vitamin E, this game-changing sunscreen from Ultra Violette is set to become your new fave. No excuses now to apply.
4. Olaplex No. 3 Hair Perfector 100ml (full size)A bestseller for a reason, this weekly at-home treatment helps reduce breakage while visibly strengthening your strands. An insider tip? Prime your hair first for even deeper repair (perfect if your mop’s in need of a little extra TLC).
5. Aspect Phytostat 9 15gThis lightweight yet nourishing moisturiser floods the skin with hydration while helping to smooth fine lines and fight free radical damage. Versatile enough for AM and PM, and suitable for all skin types? It’s the new MVP.
6. Who Is Elijah Nomad 10mlWith notes of Egyptian jasmine, saffron, and almond layered over amberwood, cedar and moss, this unisex fragrance is bound to turn heads — while still being subtle enough to wear to the grocery store.
7. Clinique Take The Day Off Cleansing Balm 30mlIf this isn’t already a staple in your evening routine, get ready: one night with this silky, lightweight balm-to-oil, and you’ll know why it’s Clinique’s #1 makeup remover. Sunscreen? Dissolved. Waterproof mascara? See you later.
8. Benefit Cosmetics 24 Hour Brow Setter 3.5mlBrows on lock all day (and night) long? Look no further. Benefit’s cult brow-setting gel boasts a dual-sized wand (for shaping *and* taming), and a flexible formula that doesn’t flake.
9. Skinstitut Gentle Cleanser 200ml (full size)Infused with soothing aloe vera, goji berry and vitamin E, this cleanser purifies and hydrates even the most sensitive of complexions. Face not that fussy? This gentle formula is also perfect pre- and post- any professional skin treatments.
10. Estée Lauder Advanced Night Repair Synchronized Multi-Recovery Complex Mini 7mlNot about that 10-step life? Estée Lauder’s bestselling serum helps to fight all key signs of ageing (think fine lines and wrinkles, tone, texture…) while keeping the complexion hydrated for up to 72 hours.
11. The Beauty Chef COLLAGEN Inner Beauty Boost 200ml (full size)Supercharge your wellness regime with this vegan, bio-fermented elixir formulated to support collagen production and defend cells against free radical damage. Healthier hair, skin and nails (and a happier gut), incoming.
12. Lancôme Lash Idôle Mascara 2.5mlA lifted, fanned-out effect *without* all the drama of false lashes? It’s possible. The magicians* at Lancôme have made a clump-free, feather-light mascara that wears flawlessly for up to 24 hours. And the best part? It’s a breeze to remove.
13. Slick Hair Co Slick Stick Anti Flyaway Hair Wand 10ml (full size)Still obsessed with Sofia Richie Grainge’s slick bun? Us too. Thankfully, this handy little hair wand houses a serum-based flyaway formula to tame stray hairs with all-day hold (sans the dreaded hairspray helmet vibes).
14. Christophe Robin Cleansing Purifying Scrub With Sea Salt 75mlCan’t remember the last time you showed your scalp some love? This deep-cleansing shampoo scrub helps to remove buildup (think oil, styling products, a little too much dry shampoo) and leave your roots feeling rebalanced and purified.
15. Real Techniques Miracle Complexion SpongeSure, you could use your fingers to apply your foundation. But when you’ve got a makeup sponge that blends, covers blemishes and navigates around tricky areas with ease, why would you?
16. Virtue Labs Healing Oil 9mlHair feeling drier than the Sahara? We got you. Virtue’s first-of-its-kind hair oil is infused with a powerful healing protein to mend, protect and restore shine to dry, damaged strands. The perfect antidote to summer sun.
17. MAKE UP FOR EVER Mist & Fix Spray 10mlAKA the only setting spray you’ll ever need. We’re obsessed with this ultra-fine, cloud-like mist that sets makeup, intensifies shadow colour, quenches skin and keeps powdery vibes at bay. Hot tip? Spritz a little after you apply each product to lock your layers in place.
18. Billie Eilish No.2 Eilish 7.5mlFans of Billie’s first fragrance and newcomers alike will love this dark, woody, alluring twist on the original. Fun fact: Billie was guided by her synesthesia, which involves all her senses to see colour, texture and shape, when creating her second-act scent.
19. L’Occitane Almond Shower Oil 35mlThis bestselling shower oil is a cult fave for a reason. Its silky oil-to-milk formula softens and nourishes the skin (perfect for pre-shaving!), gently cleanses and smells incredible. We reach for it any time we want to feel a little luxe.
20. MAKE UP FOR EVER Aqua Resist Color Pencil 0.2gWhether you want kohl, liner or shadow, this multitasking pencil ticks all the boxes. Its ultra-pigmented formula stays waterproof, sweat- and smudge-proof for 24 hours, and plays nice with sensitive eyes to boot.
21. Aveda Nutriplenish Masque Light Moisture 25mlLush locks, unlocked. This nutrient-infused hydrating treatment floods your hair with superfood ingredients (think pomegranate seed oil, mango butter and coconut oil) for softer, smoother, more manageable hair — without weighing you down.
22. Yves Saint Laurent Libre EDP 7.5mlA beauty insider favourite, Yves Saint Laurent’s Libre is a soft yet sensual floral scent that’ll quickly become your signature. Spritz on your pulse points for an intoxicating aura that lasts all day.
23. First Aid Beauty KP Bump Eraser with 10% AHA 28.3gPerfect for tackling rough texture on the body, this fast-acting scrub combines glycolic and lactic acids to help loosen the skin’s top layer and slough away decongestion. Say hello to smoother, clearer skin in no time.
To purchase the calendar,
visit The Iconic here.

author: KNEWS
title: «Jesús lo perdona todo»: El papa lava y besa los pies a 12 mujeres encarceladas
text:
Publicado:
29 mar 2024 09:49 GMT
«Todos tenemos pequeños fracasos, grandes fracasos», afirmó Francisco.
El papa Francisco realizó el «conmovedor» lavatorio de los pies en la tradicional ceremonia del Jueves Santo que en esta ocasión se celebró en una cárcel ubicada en las afueras de Roma, Italia, informa Vatican News.
El pontífice lavó y besó los pies de 12 mujeres encarceladas en la penitenciaría feminina de Rebibbia, donde varias de ellas no pudieron contener las lágrimas por el gesto de Francisco.
«Jesús lo perdona todo. Jesús siempre perdona. Solo pide que pidamos perdón», afirmó el papa. «Todos tenemos pequeños fracasos, grandes fracasos. Cada uno tiene su propia historia. Pero el Señor nos espera siempre , con los brazos abiertos, y no se cansa de perdonar», agregó.
El lavatorio de pies conmemora el gesto de Jesúscristo , que en la Última Cena hizo lo mismo con sus discípulos. En la Biblia, la ceremonia es descrita como una muestra de humildad y servicio hacia los demás sin importar la posición en que uno se encuentre porque somos todos iguales.
Desde 2013, cuando fue elegido papa, Francisco ha visitado varias prisiones. En el Jueves Santo de 2022 llegó a una cárcel de la ciudad italiana de Civitavecchia para lavar y besar los pies de 12 reclusos.
Enlace fuente https://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/504154-jesus-perdona-todo-papa-pies-12-mujeres-encarceladas?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=all

author: Artem Sandler
title: Amazon sperrt Android-Nutzer aus - ab dem 20. August
text:
In den vergangenen Jahren hat Amazon zahlreiche Services abgewertet oder eingestellt. Ungewollte Einschübe vermeidet man bei Amazon Music beispielsweise nur noch im Rahmen einer einzelnen Playlist, während Prime Video mittlerweile Werbung schaltet. Auch Amazons Streaming-Plattform Freevee musste weichen. Und selbiges gilt ab kommender Woche auch für einen weiteren Service, der in über 200 Ländern verfügbar war und nach Einschätzung von Amazon allein in der Europäischen Union knapp 45 Millionen aktive Nutzer verzeichnete.
Amazon stellt App-Service ein
Am 20. August schließt Amazon die Tore seines Appstores für Android-Nutzer. Ab diesem Zeitpunkt könne nicht mehr garantiert werden, dass Apps, die aus dem Amazon Appstore heruntergeladen wurden, weiterhin funktionieren. Und neue Apps werden sich verständlicherweise ebenfalls nicht mehr installieren lassen. Zumindest nicht über Android. Denn an auf anderen Geräten soll der Appstore weiterhin bestehen bleiben – allen voran auf Fire TV– und Fire-Tablet-Geräten.
Zu den Gründen äußerte sich Amazon bereits Anfang des Jahres: „Wir haben beschlossen, den Amazon Appstore für Android einzustellen, um unsere Bemühungen auf das Appstore-Erlebnis auf unseren eigenen Geräten zu konzentrieren, da dort derzeit die überwältigende Mehrheit unserer Kundinnen und Kunden damit interagiert“, hieß es vonseiten eines Sprechers.
Nutzer müssen handeln – oder eben nicht
Zeitgleich mit dem Amazon Appstore stellt der Händler auch sein Amazon Coins-Programm ein. Diese werden genutzt, um Einkäufe in bestimmten Apps sowie In-App-Käufe zu tätigen. Nun müssen Nutzer die Münzen jedoch bis zum 20. August verbrauchen. Es sei denn, sie wollen stattdessen ihr Geld zurück. Amazon zeigt sich hier nämlich einsichtig. So gab der Versandriese an, alle verbliebenen Coins, nach dem Stichtag zurückzuerstatten. Weitere Einzelheiten zur Erstattung wollte man dabei ursprünglich „zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt“ bekannt geben. Die dazugehörigen FAQ hat Amazon bisher jedoch nicht aktualisiert.
Über unsere Links

Auf den Preis eines Kaufs hat das keine Auswirkung. Du hilfst uns aber, inside digital weiterhin kostenlos anbieten zu können. Vielen Dank!
